messages.content: What is ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader is a simple JavaScript library that performantly and reliably breaks a video down into its individual frames using the new WebCodecs API.
Which video format is currently supported by ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader currently only supports mp4 video files.
How can you check browser support for ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
You can check browser support for ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader at https://caniuse.com/webcodecs.
Who are the original authors of the code used in ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
The original authors of the code used in ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader are the authors of the official WebCodecs demos and mp4box.js.
How can you use ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader in an HTML file?
To use ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader in an HTML file, you need to import the library, provide a canvas element, and use the `getVideoFrames` function with a video URL or file blob.
What is the purpose of the `onFrame` callback function in ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
The `onFrame` callback function in ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader is used to process each VideoFrame object obtained from the video. It can be used to draw the frame on a canvas or perform other operations.
What should be done after finishing the video processing with ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
After finishing the video processing with ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader, it is recommended to revoke the object URL created from the video file using `URL.revokeObjectURL(file)` to prevent memory leaks.
What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader extension node?
The ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader extension node allows users to load frames from a video in bulk and perform masking and sketching on each frame through a GUI.
In which category can the 'SequentialImageLoader' node be found in ComfyUI?
The 'SequentialImageLoader' node can be found in the Image category in ComfyUI.
What is the difference between the 'SequentialImageLoader' node and the 'VideoFrameExtractor' node?

The 'SequentialImageLoader' node requires specifying a directory containing frames from a video, while the 'VideoFrameExtractor' node allows specifying a video file directly (currently only mp4 format is supported).
How can a user access the Mask Editor in ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
After loading the frames, the user can right-click the node and select 'Open In MaskEditor' to access the Mask Editor.
What is the purpose of the 'Paste mask from prev' button in the Mask Editor?
The 'Paste mask from prev' button in the Mask Editor allows users to paste the mask from the previous frame to the current frame.
What are the shortcut keys for Undo and Redo operations in the Mask Editor?
The shortcut keys for Undo and Redo operations in the Mask Editor are alt+Z and shift+alt+Z, respectively.
Where does temporary frame data accumulate when using ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader?
Temporary frame data accumulates in the input/ directory when using ComfyUI-SeqImageLoader, and users should delete data that is no longer needed at an appropriate time.
